alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Carver; Chisago; Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey; Scott; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 6:00AM CST until January 15 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... .Dangerous wind chills are expected to last through Tuesday morning, with widespread values of 25 to 35 degrees below zero. A Wind Chill Advisory is in effect for Minnesota and western Wisconsin through Monday morning. After Monday morning, Wind Chill Advisories continue across western and central Minnesota through Tuesday morning. Wind Chill Advisories will return for the Twin Cities metro and western Wisconsin this evening through Tuesday morning ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central Minnesota. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 15 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Anoka; Carver; Chisago; Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey; Scott; Washington
